doctor.name: Prof. Dr. Nazmun Nahar
doctor.specialty: Vitreo Retina, Ophthalmic Trauma & Cataract Surgery Specialist
doctor.info: Prof. Dr. Nazmun Nahar completed her MBBS and Diploma in Ophthalmology from the University of Dhaka. Then she completed FCPS in Ophthalmology from Bangladesh College of Physicians and Surgeons. She is the first female Ophthalmologist in Bangladesh to achieve the FRCS degree from Royal College of Glasgow, with her second FRCS from Royal College of Edinburgh. She is a renowned Vitreo-Retina surgeon. She did her long-term fellowship in Vitreo-Retina from LV Prasad Eye Institute, Hyderabad, India and Ispahani Islamia Eye Institute & Hospital (Islamic Eye Hospital), Dhaka. She worked many years in Islamic Eye Hospital as Head of Retina department and currently is working as Professor and Head of Retina department of Lions Eye Institute and Hospital, Dhaka. Not only did she specialize in Vitreo-Retina surgery, she has extensive experience in Ophthalmic Trauma and Cataract Surgery. She has performed more than 10,000 surgeries. She is a mentor of the long-term retina fellowship program. She is a teacher and examiner of Diploma and FCPS Ophthalmology for postgraduate students. Prof. Dr. Nazmun Nahar is an expert in Retinopathy of Prematurity (ROP). She had her training on ROP from LVPEI, Hyderabad, India. She is one of the pioneers in the screening & treating of ROP in Bangladesh.

doctor.name: Dr. Ashiqur Rahman Akanda
doctor.info: Asso. Prof. Dr. Md. Ashiqur Rahman Akanda , born in 1979, obtained his MBBS degree from Shere Bangla Medical College, Barisal on 2003. He Passed DO (Diploma in Ophthalmology) from the University of Dhaka in 2006. He acquired FCPS (Eye) from Bangladesh College of Physicians & Surgeons in 2012. He has done his Fellowship in Pediatric Ophthalmology & Squint from The University of Michigan, Kellogg Eye Center, Michigan, USA which is one of the top ranked eye center of USA. He also received short term fellowship training in the respective field in ARAVIND eye institute and research center, MADURAI, INDIA. He also has hands on training in advanced Phaco surgery from Susrut Eye Institute , INDIA. Currently he is working as Associate Professor of Pediatric Ophthalmology in National Institute of Ophthalmology and Hospital , Dhaka, Bangladesh. He is interested in research and publication. He has many publications in home and abroad.He attended many conferences, symposium and seminar around the globe included INDIA, SPAIN, USA, THAILAND etc. Asso. Prof. Dr. Md. Ashiqur Rahman Akanda is the current Joint Secretary General of Association of Pediatric Ophthalmologists & Strabismologist ,Bangladesh (APOSB).

He received hands-on-training on SICS from GM Eye Hospital, Mettupalayam, Coimbatore, India in 1999 and PHACO surgeries from NIO, Dhaka in 2005. doctor.workplace: Birdem General Hospital & Ibrahim Medical College
doctor.info: Prof. Dr. Puravi Rani Dev Nath is a leading Ophthalmologist (Eye Specialist) and Surgeon in Dhaka, with vast experience in diagnosing and treating a wide range of eye conditions including cataracts, glaucoma, diabetic retinopathy, age-related macular degeneration, refractive errors, and other complex ocular diseases. She holds an MBBS and MS in Ophthalmology, and currently serves as Professor and Unit Head of Ophthalmology at Birdem General Hospital & Ibrahim Medical College, one of the country’s premier institutions for eye care and treatment. Renowned for her expertise in both medical and surgical ophthalmology, Prof. Dr. Puravi Rani Dev Nath is committed to providing compassionate, evidence-based eye care for patients of all ages. She consults at the BIRDEM Specialized Chamber Complex, Shahbag, Dhaka from 2.30pm to 7pm (Closed: Friday), offering specialized services for both common vision issues and advanced ophthalmic surgeries.

Dr. Arafat Rahman specializes in treating cataracts, diabetic retinopathy, retinal detachment, uveitis, macular degeneration, and other vitreoretinal disorders.
